docs.lead_paragraph: The British steamer Europa arrived at this port last evening, and brought three days later news from all parts of Europe. The leading feature in her accounts, is the funeral pageant of the late Duke of WELLINGTON, which took place in London on Thursday, 18th November.

headline.main: The Health of Hon. W. R King.

docs.lead_paragraph: Throughout the country there are hundreds of young men, well qualified by the possession of health, and many years of practice to labor upon the farm, who, for various reasons, leave agricultural employments for the business of teaching.
docs.snippet: Throughout the country there are hundreds of young men, well qualified by the possession of health, and many years of practice to labor upon the farm, who, for various reasons, leave agricultural employments for the business of teaching.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have the proceedings, by Telegraph, of six of the Electoral Colleges on yesterday, all which, with the exception of the New-York College, dispatched their business with the utmost promptness and unanimity At Albany there was something of a tiff between Barn burner and Hunker, in which the latter came off second best by the defeat of Mr. O'CONOR for the Presidency of the College.

headline.main: Failure of the Southern Mail--Death of a Member of the Virginia Legislature--Health of Senator William R. King.
DANIEL WEBSTER.; THE OBSEQUIES IN BOSTON. EULOGY PRONOUNCED IN FANEUIL HALL, By Special Express to the New-York Daily Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: The telegraph brings us a Sketch of the imposing ceremonial at Boston, yesterday, in honor of the memory of Mr. WEBSTER. The procession was very long, and the obsequies imposing and touching in the highest degree. At Faneuil Hall, which had been appropriately decorated for the occasion, and which was crowded to its utmost capacity, GEORGE S. HILLARD, Esq., pronounced the following eulogy:

headline.main: BIOGRAPHICAL.; The Private Life and Domestic Experiences of Captain Thrifty.

docs.lead_paragraph: IN TWO CHAPTERS--CHAPTER ONE. Capt. THIRFTY was born of poor but honest parents; and indeed it was their unbending honesty that was near ruining the financial prospects of the lad, for they taught him that it was better to be poor than to get riches after the fashion of Aldermen, and to be honest than to be President.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE EXTRAORDINARY COUNTERFEITING CASE.--THE FEXUERS COMMITTED BY THE UNITED STATES AUTHORITIES.--The important case of the persons arrested for counterfeiting the coin of the United states, as reported in the Daily Times of Tuesday, has been transferred to the jurisdiction of the officers of the General Government.

docs.lead_paragraph: TRIBUTE TO DANIEL WEBSTER.--On Monday evening last the citizens or Jamaica, L. I, assembled at the Union Hall Academy, to testify their appreciation of the late Mr. WEBSTER. The meeting was organized by calling Dr. NATHAN SHELTON to the chair, and appointing MARTIN I. JOHNSON Secretary.
